page.title: 01Westerdale Village and Dale
page.content: Westerdale Village has an approximate population of 50 plus 50 in the surrounding area. The village lies in a small dale surrounded by moorland. Many of the village people commute to Teeside, very few work on the land. The dale has 15 small farms, they have a small amount of cultivated land but mainly consist of pasture, rough grazing and moorland. The latter is used to run sheep on for wool and lamb. and also for grouse shooting. The public and community services consist of a Post Office Church, Chapel, Village Hall and a Youth Hostel. The latter being housed in a former country manor. This mixed community of farmers and commuters has an excellent social life centred on the Village Hall where evening classes over 60's and Womens Institute meetings, whilst drives and dances
